snippet: The length of a prison stay increased by more than a third over the past two decades, a period of time in which the prison population doubled, according to a report by the Pew Center on the States.
abstract: Pew Center on the States reports that for petty offenders and violent criminals alike, the length of a prison stay increased by more than a third over the past two decades, a period of time in which the prison population doubled.
lead_paragraph: The length of a prison stay increased by more than a third over the past two decades, a period of time in which the prison population doubled, according to a report by the Pew Center on the States.

headline.main: Average Prison Stay Grew 36 Percent in Two Decades
